faq.title: Frequently Asked
faq.subtitle: Here, we have listed some of the commonly asked questions from the community.

upscaleQuality.question: Can you upscale a photo without losing quality?
upscaleQuality.answer: Yes. AI upscaling preserves quality by using deep learning algorithms that reconstruct details of your image instead of just stretching pixels. Our Real-ESRGAN and GFPGAN models analyze your image and intelligently add realistic details.

bestFreeTool.question: What's the best free tool to upscale images?
bestFreeTool.answer: Pixelift is a top-rated free online tool. This offers watermark-free enhancement with AI-powered 2x, 4x, or 8x upscaling. We provide 3 free credits to start, with no signup required.

mobileSupport.question: Does Pixelift work on mobile?
mobileSupport.answer: Yes, you can use Pixelift on your mobile browser without needing to install any apps or software. Our interface is fully responsive and optimized for touch devices.

aiVsManual.question: How is AI upscaling better than manual resizing?
aiVsManual.answer: Since Pixelift is backed by AI, it adds realistic details to your images. This is done by using neural networks, which ensures you have high-resolution images as compared to manual resizing, which stretches out pixels, resulting in blurring.

artworkSupport.question: Can AI enhance artwork, anime, or illustrations?
artworkSupport.answer: Yes. AI image-enhancing tools like Pixelift work exceptionally well for digital art, anime, and sketches. We recommend using our 'Art & Illustration' preset, which uses 8x upscaling optimized for preserving line art quality and colors without distortion.

formats.question: What image formats are supported?
formats.answer: Pixelift supports PNG, JPG, JPEG, WEBP, HEIC, and BMP formats. Maximum file size is 10MB for free users, with higher limits available for premium subscribers.

processingTime.question: How long does processing take?
processingTime.answer: Most images are processed in 10-20 seconds, depending on the selected upscaling level and whether face enhancement is enabled. 2x upscaling is fastest, while 8x with face enhancement may take up to 30 seconds.

dataSafety.question: Is my data safe?
dataSafety.answer: Yes. All images are processed securely using HTTPS encryption and automatically deleted from our servers after 24 hours. We never share your data with third parties and comply with GDPR regulations.

aiPresets.question: What are AI Presets and which one should I use?
aiPresets.answer: AI Presets are pre-configured settings optimized for different image types. Use 'Portrait Mode' for photos with faces, 'Landscape Mode' for nature/architecture, 'Art & Illustration' for digital art, 'Photo Restoration' for old photos, or 'Maximum Quality' for professional use.

batchProcessing.question: Can I process multiple images at once?
batchProcessing.answer: Batch processing is available for Pro and Enterprise subscribers. Free users can process one image at a time, while premium users can upload and process up to 50 images simultaneously with our bulk transformation feature.

scalingDifference.question: What's the difference between 2x, 4x, and 8x upscaling?
scalingDifference.answer: The number indicates how much we increase the resolution. 2x doubles both width and height (4x total pixels), 4x quadruples dimensions (16x total pixels), and 8x multiplies by eight (64x total pixels). Higher upscaling takes longer but produces larger, more detailed images.

groupPhotos.question: Does face enhancement work on group photos?
groupPhotos.answer: Yes! Our GFPGAN face enhancement AI can detect and enhance multiple faces in a single image. It works great for group photos, wedding pictures, and family portraits. Enable 'Face Enhancement' or use the 'Portrait Mode' preset for best results.

commercialUse.question: Can I use upscaled images commercially?
commercialUse.answer: Yes, you retain full ownership of your images. Free users can use upscaled images for any purpose, including commercial use. We don't add watermarks or claim any rights to your content.

aiModels.question: What AI models do you use?
aiModels.answer: We use Real-ESRGAN for general image upscaling and GFPGAN for facial enhancement. These are state-of-the-art AI models trained on millions of images to produce realistic, high-quality results.

credits.question: How do credits work?
credits.answer: Each processed image costs 1 credit. Free users get 3 credits to start. You can purchase more credits through one-time packages or subscribe to a monthly plan for automatic credit refills. Credits never expire.

whatIs.title: What is AI Image Upscaling?
whatIs.p1: AI image upscaling is an advanced technology that uses artificial intelligence and machine learning to increase image resolution while preserving or even enhancing quality. Unlike traditional resizing methods that simply stretch pixels, our AI-powered upscaler analyzes your image and intelligently reconstructs details, resulting in sharp, high-quality photos at larger sizes.
whatIs.p2: Pixelift leverages state-of-the-art AI models including Real-ESRGAN and GFPGAN to deliver professional-grade results. Whether you're enhancing portraits, landscapes, artwork, or vintage photographs, our platform provides the tools you need to achieve stunning results in seconds.

q1.question: What's the difference between 2x, 4x, and 8x?
q1.answer: 2x doubles dimensions (e.g., 500px → 1000px), 4x quadruples (500px → 2000px), 8x multiplies by eight (500px → 4000px). Higher scale = more AI-generated details.

q2.question: When should I use face enhancement?
q2.answer: Enable GFPGAN when your image contains faces, especially blurry or low-resolution ones. The model specializes in facial feature reconstruction.

q3.question: How many credits does upscaling cost?
q3.answer: Basic upscaling costs 1 credit regardless of scale. GFPGAN face enhancement adds +1 credit (2 credits total).

q4.question: What formats are supported?
q4.answer: We support JPEG, PNG, and WEBP. Output is always PNG for maximum quality. Maximum file size is 10MB.

q5.question: Can I upscale an already upscaled image?
q5.answer: Yes, but results may be worse. AI works best on original images. For very small photos, we recommend 8x directly instead of multiple upscaling passes.

q2.answer: Logos are delivered in high-resolution PNG format with transparent background. This works for web, print, and most design applications.

q4.question: Can I request revisions?
q4.answer: Each generation creates a new, unique logo. To get variations, simply adjust your inputs (style, colors, description) and generate again.

q5.question: What if I don't like the results?
q5.answer: Try different style options or provide more specific industry/color details. The AI responds well to clear, descriptive inputs.

q1.question: What's the difference between raster and vector?
q1.answer: Raster images (PNG, JPG) are made of pixels and become blurry when scaled up. Vector graphics (SVG) use mathematical paths and scale infinitely without quality loss.

q2.question: Can I edit the SVG output?
q2.answer: Yes! SVG files can be opened and edited in Adobe Illustrator, Figma, Inkscape, and other vector editing software.

q3.question: Will photos convert well to vector?
q3.answer: Photographs produce stylized, abstract vector interpretations. Vectorization works best with logos, icons, and graphics with clear shapes.

q4.question: How many colors can the output have?
q4.answer: Full color mode supports up to 256 colors. You can also limit colors for simpler outputs or choose grayscale/black & white modes.

q5.question: What file formats are supported?
q5.answer: Input: PNG, JPG, JPEG, WEBP. Output is always SVG (Scalable Vector Graphics), the industry standard for vector graphics.

q1.question: Is the QR generator really free?
q1.answer: Yes! QR code generation is 100% free with no limits. No account or credits required. Codes are generated directly in your browser.

q2.question: Will QR codes work with my logo?
q2.answer: Yes, thanks to error correction. We recommend using higher error correction levels (Q or H) when adding logos, and keeping logo size reasonable.

q3.question: What content can I encode?
q3.answer: URLs, plain text, phone numbers, email addresses, WiFi credentials, and more. Most scanners auto-detect content type.

q4.question: What size should I print QR codes?
q4.answer: Minimum 2cm x 2cm for reliable scanning. For scanning from distance, increase size proportionally (e.g., 10cm for 1 meter distance).

q5.question: Do QR codes expire?
q5.answer: No! QR codes are static data and never expire. However, if you encode a URL that changes or goes offline, the QR won't lead anywhere useful.

faqPage.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faqPage.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about Pixelift AI tools

whatIsPixelift.question: What is Pixelift?
whatIsPixelift.answer: Pixelift is an AI-powered image editing platform that offers professional tools for image upscaling, background removal, colorization, restoration, and more. All processing is done using cutting-edge AI models like Real-ESRGAN, BRIA, and DDColor.

howDoesItWork.question: How does AI image processing work?
howDoesItWork.answer: Our AI models analyze your images using deep learning neural networks trained on millions of images. They understand image content, context, and details to make intelligent enhancements rather than simple pixel manipulation.

whatFormats.question: What image formats are supported?
whatFormats.answer: We support PNG, JPG, JPEG, WEBP, HEIC, and BMP formats. Maximum file size is 10MB for free users, with higher limits for premium subscribers.

maxFileSize.question: What is the maximum file size?
maxFileSize.answer: Free users can upload images up to 10MB. Premium users have higher limits. For best results with upscaling, we recommend images at least 500x500 pixels.

isFree.question: Is Pixelift free to use?
isFree.answer: Yes! New users get 3 free credits to try any of our tools. Each tool costs 1-3 credits per use. You can purchase more credits or subscribe for monthly credits.

whatAreCredits.question: What are credits and how do they work?
whatAreCredits.answer: Credits are our payment system. Each AI processing task costs 1-3 credits depending on complexity. New users get 3 free credits. Credits never expire and can be purchased in packages or through subscriptions.

refunds.question: Do you offer refunds?
refunds.answer: Due to the high cost of AI processing, we don't offer refunds on credits. We recommend trying our free credits first to ensure the tools meet your needs before purchasing.

imageQuality.question: How good is the image quality?
imageQuality.answer: Our AI models produce professional-grade results. Upscaling maintains sharp details even at 8x, background removal handles complex edges like hair, and colorization produces natural, realistic colors.

processingTime.question: How long does processing take?
processingTime.answer: Most operations complete in 5-20 seconds depending on the tool and image size. Upscaling to 8x may take up to 30 seconds for large images.

apiAccess.question: Is there an API available?
apiAccess.answer: Yes! We offer a REST API for developers and businesses. API documentation is available in your dashboard. Enterprise customers can request custom API limits and dedicated support.

dataPrivacy.question: Is my data private and secure?
dataPrivacy.answer: Yes. All images are encrypted during transfer (HTTPS/TLS) and automatically deleted from our servers within 24 hours. We never share your data with third parties and are fully GDPR compliant.

deleteAccount.question: How do I delete my account?
deleteAccount.answer: You can delete your account from Settings > Account > Delete Account. This will permanently remove all your data, including processing history. Unused credits will be forfeited.

whatAreCookies.title: What Are Cookies?
whatAreCookies.content: Cookies are small text files that are placed on your computer or mobile device when you visit a website. They are widely used to make websites work more efficiently and provide information to website owners.

howWeUse.title: How We Use Cookies
howWeUse.content: Pixelift uses cookies to enhance your browsing experience, analyze site traffic, and personalize content. We use both first-party cookies (set by us) and third-party cookies (set by our service providers).

necessary.title: Necessary Cookies
necessary.description: These cookies are essential for the website to function properly. They enable basic functions like page navigation, authentication, and access to secure areas of the website.

functional.title: Functional Cookies
functional.description: These cookies enable enhanced functionality and personalization, such as remembering your preferences, language settings, and user interface customizations.

analytics.title: Analytics Cookies
analytics.description: These cookies help us understand how visitors interact with our website by collecting and reporting information anonymously. This helps us improve our service and user experience.

marketing.title: Marketing Cookies
marketing.description: These cookies are used to track visitors across websites to display relevant advertisements. They help us measure the effectiveness of our marketing campaigns.

thirdParty.title: Third-Party Cookies
thirdParty.intro: We use services from third-party providers that may set their own cookies:

items.replicateDesc: For image processing (no cookies set directly)

managing.title: Managing Your Cookie Preferences
managing.intro: You can control and manage cookies in several ways:

items.bannerDesc: When you first visit our site, you can choose which cookies to accept
items.browserDesc: Most browsers allow you to block or delete cookies through their settings
items.optOutDesc: Some third-party services provide opt-out mechanisms

managing.warningText: If you disable necessary cookies, some features of our website may not function properly. You may experience reduced functionality or be unable to use certain features.

browserInstructions.title: Browser-Specific Instructions
browserInstructions.chromeInstr: Settings → Privacy and security → Cookies and other site data
browserInstructions.firefoxInstr: Settings → Privacy & Security → Cookies and Site Data
browserInstructions.edgeInstr: Settings → Cookies and site permissions → Manage and delete cookies

retention.title: Cookie Retention
retention.intro: Cookies are stored for different periods depending on their purpose:
retention.sessionDesc: Deleted when you close your browser
retention.persistentDesc: Remain on your device for a set period (typically 1-2 years)

gdprPage.title: GDPR Compliance
gdprPage.subtitle: Your data protection rights under the General Data Protection Regulation

commitment.title: Our Commitment to GDPR
commitment.content: Pixelift is committed to protecting your personal data and respecting your privacy rights. We comply with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and other applicable data protection laws.

rights.title: Your GDPR Rights
rights.intro: Under GDPR, you have the following rights regarding your personal data:

access.title: Right to Access
access.description: You can request a copy of all personal data we hold about you.

rectification.title: Right to Rectification
rectification.description: You can request correction of inaccurate or incomplete data.

erasure.title: Right to Erasure (Right to be Forgotten)
erasure.description: You can request deletion of your personal data in certain circumstances.

restrict.title: Right to Restrict Processing
restrict.description: You can request that we limit how we use your data.

portability.title: Right to Data Portability
portability.description: You can request your data in a structured, commonly used format.

object.title: Right to Object
object.description: You can object to certain types of processing, including direct marketing.

automated.title: Rights Related to Automated Decision Making
automated.description: You have the right not to be subject to decisions based solely on automated processing.

dataCollection.title: Data We Collect
dataCollection.intro: We collect and process the following types of personal data:

items.accountDesc: Name, email address, profile picture (when you sign up)

To process your images using AI technology

To communicate with you about service updates

international.content: Your data may be transferred to and processed in countries outside the European Economic Area (EEA). We ensure appropriate safeguards are in place, including Standard Contractual Clauses approved by the European Commission.

refundPage.title: Refund Policy

overview.title: 1. Overview
overview.intro: At Pixelift, we strive to provide high-quality AI image processing services. We understand that sometimes things don't work out as expected, and we want to ensure you have a fair experience.
overview.commitment: This Refund Policy outlines the conditions under which you may request a refund for our services, including subscription plans and credit purchases.

eligibility.title: 2. Refund Eligibility
eligibility.intro: You may be eligible for a refund in the following cases:
items: Request made within 14 days of purchase (EU Consumer Rights)
No credits have been used from your purchase
Technical issues on our end prevented service delivery
Duplicate or erroneous charges

nonEligible.title: 3. Non-Refundable Cases
nonEligible.intro: Refunds are generally not available in these situations:
items: Credits have already been used for image processing
Request made more than 14 days after purchase
Service was delivered successfully as described
Violation of our Terms of Service

subscriptions.title: 4. Subscription Refunds
subscriptions.cancellationDesc: You can cancel your subscription at any time from your dashboard. Your subscription will remain active until the end of the current billing period.
subscriptions.refundDesc: If you cancel within 14 days of subscribing and haven't used any credits, you may request a full refund.
subscriptions.proratedDesc: Prorated refunds are not available. Upon cancellation, you retain access until the end of your billing period.

creditPurchases.title: 5. One-Time Credit Purchases
creditPurchases.unusedDesc: If you haven't used any credits from your purchase, you may request a full refund within 14 days.
creditPurchases.partialDesc: If some credits have been used, we may offer a partial refund at our discretion, calculated based on unused credits minus a processing fee.

process.title: 6. How to Request a Refund
process.intro: To request a refund, follow these steps:
steps: Send an email to refunds@pixelift.pl with the subject "Refund Request"
Include your registered email address and order details
Describe the reason for your refund request
Allow up to 5 business days for our team to review your request
process.timing: Approved refunds are typically processed within 5-10 business days and will be returned to your original payment method.

exceptions.title: 7. Exceptions
exceptions.intro: We may make exceptions to this policy in certain circumstances:
exceptions.technicalDesc: If our service experienced significant downtime or technical issues affecting your ability to use purchased credits, we will provide appropriate compensation.
exceptions.billingDesc: Unauthorized or duplicate charges will be refunded promptly upon verification.

euRights.title: 8. EU Consumer Rights
euRights.intro: If you are a consumer in the European Union, you have the right to withdraw from a distance contract within 14 days without giving any reason.
euRights.withdrawal: The withdrawal period expires 14 days from the day of the conclusion of the contract. To exercise the right of withdrawal, you must inform us of your decision by an unequivocal statement (e.g., a letter sent by post or e-mail).
euRights.exception: Please note that the right of withdrawal does not apply to digital content that has been accessed or used (i.e., credits that have been consumed for image processing).

contact.title: 9. Contact Us
contact.intro: If you have questions about this Refund Policy or need assistance, please contact us:

refundPage.euNote: This refund policy complies with EU Consumer Protection Directive 2011/83/EU and applicable consumer protection laws.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1: How long does video generation take?
faq.a1: Generation time varies by model and duration. PixVerse takes 1-3 minutes, Kling 2-5 minutes, and Veo 3-7 minutes. You'll see a progress indicator during generation.
faq.q2: What video formats and resolutions are supported?
faq.a2: We support 720p and 1080p resolutions in multiple aspect ratios: 16:9 (widescreen), 9:16 (vertical/mobile), 1:1 (square), and 4:3. Output format is MP4.
faq.q3: Can I use generated videos commercially?
faq.a3: Yes! All videos you generate are yours to use commercially. You retain full rights to your creations for marketing, social media, or any business purpose.
faq.a4: PixVerse is great for fast, general-purpose videos. Kling excels at motion and action scenes. Veo offers the highest quality with audio for premium productions.
faq.a5: If video generation fails, your credits are automatically refunded. You can try again with adjusted settings or a different model.
faq.q6: Can I create videos from my images?
faq.a6: Yes! PixVerse, Kling, and Runway support image-to-video generation. Upload an image to animate it into a video.

technology.feature2: Realistic background generation matched to product

tips.title: Tips for Best Results
tips.tip1: Use well-lit photos with clearly visible product
tips.tip2: Avoid photos with very complex backgrounds - AI works best with simple ones
tips.tip3: For custom prompts be specific: describe surface, lighting and style
tips.tip4: 'Studio' preset works best for Amazon and marketplace requirements
tips.tip5: Single products give better results than product groups

q1.question: What file formats are supported?
q1.answer: JPG, JPEG, PNG and WEBP. Max 30MB. For best results, use images at least 1000x1000 pixels.

q2.question: How much does it cost?
q2.answer: Each generation costs 2 credits. New users get 3 free credits. Additional credits in affordable packages.

q3.question: Can I use generated images commercially?
q3.answer: Yes! All images are fully commercial. Use in stores, ads, catalogs without restrictions.

q4.question: How to write a good custom prompt?
q4.answer: Be specific: surface (marble, wood), lighting (studio, natural), style (minimalist, luxury). Example: 'Elegant black marble, soft studio lighting, luxury atmosphere'.

q5.question: What if result is not satisfactory?

formatComparison.title: Image Format Comparison Guide
formatComparison.description: Choose the right format for your needs. Each format has unique strengths for different use cases.

jpg.title: JPG (JPEG) Format
jpg.description: The most widely used image format on the internet. JPG uses lossy compression, meaning some image data is discarded to achieve smaller file sizes. Best for photographs and complex images with many colors. Not ideal for graphics with sharp edges, text, or images requiring transparency.
jpg.pros: Universal compatibility, small file sizes, great for photos
jpg.cons: Lossy compression, no transparency, quality degrades with re-saving

png.title: PNG Format
png.description: PNG (Portable Network Graphics) uses lossless compression, preserving all image data. Supports full transparency (alpha channel), making it perfect for logos, icons, and graphics that need to overlay other content. Larger file sizes than JPG but maintains perfect quality.
png.pros: Lossless quality, transparency support, sharp edges preserved
png.cons: Larger file sizes, not ideal for photographs

webp.title: WebP Format
webp.description: Developed by Google, WebP provides superior compression for web images. Supports both lossy and lossless compression, plus transparency and animation. WebP images are typically 25-35% smaller than JPG at equivalent quality. Supported by all modern browsers since 2020.
webp.pros: Excellent compression, transparency, animation support, widely supported
webp.cons: Not supported by some older software and email clients

avif.title: AVIF Format
avif.description: AVIF (AV1 Image Format) is the newest image format, offering even better compression than WebP. Based on the AV1 video codec, AVIF can achieve 50% smaller file sizes than JPG. Supports HDR, wide color gamut, and transparency. Supported in Chrome, Firefox, and Safari.
avif.pros: Best compression ratio, HDR support, excellent quality
avif.cons: Slower encoding, limited support in older browsers/software

gif.title: GIF Format
gif.description: GIF (Graphics Interchange Format) is best known for animation support. Limited to 256 colors, making it unsuitable for photographs but perfect for simple graphics, icons, and short animations. Universal browser support and widely used for memes and reactions.
gif.pros: Animation support, universal compatibility, simple transparency
gif.cons: Limited to 256 colors, larger file sizes for animations

q1.question: Is this image converter really free?
q1.answer: Yes, 100% free with no hidden costs. Unlike other tools, we don't require registration, don't add watermarks, and don't limit how many images you can convert. This tool is offered free as part of our mission to make basic image tools accessible to everyone.

q2.question: What's the maximum file size I can convert?
q2.answer: You can upload images up to 20MB in size. This is sufficient for most high-resolution photos and graphics. For larger files, consider using our Image Compressor tool first to reduce the file size.

q3.question: Are my images stored on your servers?
q3.answer: No. Your images are processed in real-time and immediately discarded after conversion. We don't store, view, or share your images. Your privacy is fully protected.

q4.question: Which format should I choose for my website?
q4.answer: For most websites in 2024, WebP is the best choice - it offers excellent compression with wide browser support (97%+ globally). For cutting-edge performance, consider AVIF, though check your audience's browser support first. Use JPG as a fallback for maximum compatibility.

q5.question: Will converting my image reduce its quality?
q5.answer: It depends on the conversion. Converting to PNG is lossless (no quality loss). Converting to JPG, WebP, or AVIF involves compression - use higher quality settings (80-100%) to minimize quality loss. Converting from a lossy format to another lossy format may accumulate quality loss.

q6.question: Can I convert multiple images at once?
q6.answer: Currently, our tool converts one image at a time for optimal quality control. For batch conversions, you can quickly convert multiple images by uploading them sequentially - our instant processing makes this fast and efficient.

q7.question: What's the difference between WebP and AVIF?
q7.answer: Both are modern formats with excellent compression. AVIF typically achieves 20-30% smaller files than WebP at the same quality, but takes longer to encode. WebP has broader software support, while AVIF is newer but supported in all major browsers. Choose WebP for compatibility, AVIF for maximum compression.

q8.question: Why can't I open my converted AVIF/WebP file?
q8.answer: Some older software doesn't support modern formats. If you need to open AVIF or WebP in older applications, convert them to PNG or JPG first. Most software released after 2020 supports WebP, and 2022+ generally supports AVIF.

q3.question: Can I remove large watermarks?

q4.question: Is this legal?
q4.answer: Removing watermarks from images you own or have permission to edit is fine. Removing watermarks to avoid paying for licensed content is not.

q5.question: What's the difference between auto and manual mode?
q5.answer: Auto mode uses AI to detect watermarks. Manual mode lets you paint over specific areas. Use manual for precise control or when auto misses parts.

q3.answer: Style transfer uses a specific reference image for the style. Reimagine uses AI prompts to generate new interpretations.

q4.question: Can I control how strong the effect is?
q4.answer: Yes, you can adjust the style strength from subtle hints to full artistic transformation.

q5.question: What resolution are the outputs?
q5.answer: Outputs match your input resolution up to our maximum supported size, ensuring high-quality results.

q1.question: What is structure control?
q1.answer: It's a way to guide AI image generation using structural information (depth, edges, poses) from a reference image.

q2.question: Which control type should I use?
q2.answer: Depth for 3D scenes, edge for shapes and outlines, pose for characters. Experiment to find what works best.

q3.question: Can I use any image as a reference?
q3.answer: Yes, any image can be analyzed for its structure. Clearer images with defined elements work best.

q4.question: How is this different from style transfer?
q4.answer: Style transfer changes appearance while keeping content. Structure control generates new content while keeping structure.

q5.question: What resolution are outputs?
q5.answer: Outputs are generated at up to 1024x1024 or matching aspect ratio for high-quality results.
